generation_results.commit_message:
fix: ensure transactionStarted is set for V2 transactions

Update transaction handling in V2 to properly track started state and handle EndTxn requests when no operations are added. This prevents incorrect handling of completed transactions during sendOffsetsToTransaction and partition addition operations.

fix: Prevent sending EndTxnRequest for empty transactions in V2

KAFKA-18401: Fix issue where transaction version 2 incorrectly sends EndTxnRequest when no records or offsets were added.

```commit-message
feat: add -skip-empty-file option to getmerge

Add flag to skip appending newline delimiters for empty files when using -nl [HADOOP-12657]. Includes tests validating flag behavior for zero-byte files.
```

```commit-message
fix: truncate exception messages to prevent resource exhaustion

Limit exception message size to 1024 characters with ... suffix [AMQ-6894]. This reduces memory/thread consumption from oversized messages during repeated failover attempts.
```

```commit-message
fix: remove schema version check for hint delivery

Allow dispatching hints during schema mismatches to improve upgrade/mixed-version cluster resilience [CASSANDRA-20188].
```

```commit-message
fix: handle empty transactions correctly in transaction version 2

Prevent sending EndTxnRequest when no records are sent in transaction version 2 [KAFKA-18401]. This maintains consistent behavior with previous transaction versions when committing empty transactions.
```

perf: Avoid NPE in interceptors and optimize time measurement in RecordAccumulator

Extract record info early to prevent NPEs in interceptors and optimize time measurement by moving time update before buffer allocation.

perf: optimize record accumulation and logging in KafkaProducer

Improve performance by reducing object references and optimizing time tracking in record accumulation [KafkaProducer]. Includes changes to handle buffer allocation and logging more efficiently during record processing.

perf: optimize record accumulation and logging in KafkaProducer

Improve performance by reducing object references and optimizing time tracking in record accumulation. Includes changes to handle buffer allocation, logging, and partition handling more efficiently during record processing.

feat: add client and thread state metrics

Add metrics for Kafka Streams client state and thread state tracking. Includes ordinal state values for telemetry and thread-level state visibility.

feat: add client-state, thread-state, and recording-level metrics

Add metrics for Kafka Streams client state, thread state, and metrics recording level [KAFKA-17561]. Includes new metrics to track client and thread states, as well as the current metrics recording level.

refactor: improve class loading isolation for plugins

Adjust class loader order to ensure child-first delegation and proper classpath handling. Added tests to verify isolation of classpath plugins.

fix: KAFKA-18211: Fix isolated plugin scanning with ClassGraph

Update ReflectionScanner to correctly order classloaders when scanning plugins to ensure isolated loading. Add test to verify classpath plugins are loaded in isolation.

refactor: introduce weak reference metrics source to prevent memory leaks

Introduce WeakRefMetricsSource to manage metrics registration without strong references [HADOOP-12657]. Update S3AInstrumentation to use weak references for metrics sources and add tests for instrumentation lifecycle and closed filesystem behavior.

fix: Address S3AInstrumentation memory leak via weak metrics references

Added WeakRefMetricsSource to avoid retaining S3AInstrumentation instances in the metrics registry, preventing memory leaks. Updated S3AInstrumentation to properly unregister its metrics source and handle metrics system lifecycle. Added tests to verify proper cleanup of metrics sources.

Ticket: HADOOP-18526

fix: prevent metric source leaks in S3AFileSystem

Use weak references for metrics sources to avoid retaining large objects [HADOOP-18526]. Includes tests verifying proper lifecycle management and metric system cleanup.

refactor: introduce Sizes utility class for consistent size constants

Introduce Sizes utility class to centralize size constants and refactor several components to use these constants. This includes replacing hardcoded size values with constants and updating imports and tests accordingly.

refactor: Update vector read configuration to use size constants

Update the min and max values for vector IO reads to use constants from Sizes.java. This aligns local, s3a, and abfs filesystems with the new vector read thresholds. The changes include updating test configurations to reflect the new constants.

HADOOP-19229

Okay, I need to write a concise commit message based on the Git diff and relevant source code provided. The user has given four different Git diffs and their corresponding relevant source code, each with a commit type. I need to handle each one individually.

Starting with Git diff 1, which is about the hadoop-common-project. The diff shows changes in the CopyCommands.java and TestFsShellCopy.java files. Looking at the changes, the main addition is a new option called "-skip-empty-file" in the getmerge command. This option allows users to skip adding newline delimiters for empty files when using the -nl flag. The commit type is 'feat', so it's a feature addition. The commit message should reflect this, mentioning the new option and its purpose, along with the relevant JIRA issue HADOOP-12657. Also, the test cases were updated to include this new option, so that should be mentioned in the body.

Moving on to Git diff 2, which is in the activemq-client project. The changes are in the BaseDataStreamMarshaller.java file. The main change here is the addition of a method called cutMessageIfNeeded, which truncates exception messages to a maximum size of 1024 characters, appending '...' if they exceed this limit. This is a fix to prevent resource exhaustion, so the commit type is 'fix'. The commit message should explain that exception messages are now truncated and mention the JIRA issue AMQ-6894.

Git diff 3 is from the Cassandra project, specifically the HintsDispatchTrigger.java file. The change removes a schema version check during hint dispatch. This allows hints to be dispatched even during schema mismatches, improving cluster resilience. The commit type is 'fix', so the message should state that the schema version check is removed and reference the JIRA issue CASSANDRA-20188.

Lastly, Git diff 4 is another change in the hadoop-common-project, this time in RunJar.java. The modification involves creating a temporary directory with specific permissions using PosixFilePermissions. Previously, the code used File.createTempFile, which might not set the correct permissions. The new approach uses Files.createTempDirectory with the correct attributes. The commit type is 'chore', indicating a maintenance or refactoring task. The commit message should explain the change in how the temporary directory is created and mention the permissions set.

fix: Set permissions for temporary directory in RunJar.run()

HADOOP-19031: CVE-2024-23454: Temporarily fix permissions on Unix-like systems by setting 700 permissions on the temporary directory to prevent local information disclosure.

fix: set permissions for temporary directory in RunJar

Set POSIX permissions to 0700 for temporary directories created by RunJar to prevent unauthorized access [HADOOP-19031]. This addresses a security vulnerability where sensitive data in temporary files could be exposed to other local users.

fix: add validation to prevent invalid buffer size in BlockCompressorStream

Add validation to ensure buffer size is not less than compression overhead, preventing potential issues with insufficient buffer space for compressed data.

fix: add validation for buffer size in BlockCompressorStream

Fixes HADOOP-19339 by adding validation to ensure bufferSize is not less than compressionOverhead. Throws IllegalArgumentException if the condition is violated, preventing negative MAX_INPUT_SIZE and associated issues.

fix: fix buffer size validation in BlockCompressorStream

Prevent negative MAX_INPUT_SIZE by validating bufferSize >= compressionOverhead [HADOOP-19339]. Throw IllegalArgumentException if condition not met to avoid ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException.

Enable metastore.housekeeping.threads.on, compactor.initiator.on, and compactor.cleaner.on by default to support Hive ACID transactions and optimize resource usage. fix: enhance page file recovery and prevent corruption

Prevent loading corrupt page files and stop recovery buffer resizing. Add test for missing recovery files.

fix: Remove problematic setLength() calls in PageFile and update tests

Removed setLength() calls in PageFile that caused exceptions when interacting with the recovery file. Added test cases to verify recovery behavior without these calls.

[Jira ID: AMQ-9547]

fix: remove setLength calls in PageFile to prevent recovery exceptions

Stop using setLength on recovery files since it always throws exceptions [AMQ-9547]. Remove problematic calls and adjust recovery process to handle file length checks internally.

fix: handle SSLSocket reflection access issues

Modify IntrospectionSupport to handle SSLSocket reflection access similar to SSLServerSocket to prevent illegal access exceptions in JDK 11+ [AMQ-6895]. This ensures proper property setting on both server and client SSL sockets across different JDK versions.

fix: Handle SSLSocket to fix SSL client socket configuration issues

AMQ-9473: Added handling for SSLSocket instances in IntrospectionSupport to resolve illegal access exceptions when setting socket properties.

fix: fix SSL socket configuration issues

Fix socket parameter configuration for SSLSocket instances in client and pool modules [AMQ-9473]. Adds handling for SSLSocket to overcome illegal access issues when setting properties.

The commit messages for each diff are as follows:

1. **feat: add -skip-empty-file option to getmerge**
   - Adds a new `-skip-empty-file` option to the `getmerge` command. This option prevents appending newline delimiters for empty files when using `-nl`. Includes tests to validate the new functionality.

2. **fix: truncate exception messages to prevent resource exhaustion**
   - Introduces a maximum size limit of 1024 characters for exception messages, appending "..." if they exceed this limit. This prevents memory issues caused by large messages during repeated operations.

3. **fix: remove schema version check for hint delivery**
   - Removes the schema version check when dispatching hints. This allows hints to be sent even during schema mismatches, enhancing cluster resilience during upgrades.

4. **fix: add null checks to prevent exceptions**
   - Implements additional null checks in the commitRemove method to ensure proper handling of message acknowledgments, preventing potential null pointer exceptions.

Each commit message is structured to clearly convey the change, its purpose, and any relevant context or tests.

fix: Handle null checks to prevent NPE in commitRemove

This addresses NullPointerExceptions causing connection leaks by adding null checks in the commitRemove method. References #{AMQ-7424}, #{AMQ-7480}. The changes ensure proper handling of null values, preventing connection leaks and enabling system recovery after high load or transaction timeouts.

fix: prevent NPE in commitRemove during XA transaction

Add null checks to avoid NullPointerException in commitRemove method [AMQ-7424, AMQ-7480]. Prevents connection leaks by ensuring proper handling of null values during transaction rollback.

The commit addresses NullPointerExceptions during XA transaction rollbacks by ensuring proper exception handling, preventing connection leaks and enabling system recovery. It references the relevant JIRA tickets and explains the changes made.

**Commit Message:**

fix: handle NullPointerException during XA transaction rollback

This change fixes NullPointerExceptions during XA transaction rollbacks, preventing connection leaks and enabling proper system recovery after high database load or transaction timeouts. Fixes AMQ-7424 and AMQ-7480 by converting NullPointerExceptions to IOExceptions and ensuring proper exception handling during rollback.

fix: prevent NPE during XA transaction rollback

Add null checks to avoid NullPointerExceptions during rollback processing [AMQ-7480, AMQ-7424]. This prevents connection leaks and improves recovery during transaction failures.

feat: add handling for ConnectionInfo and RemoveInfo messages in AMQP transformer

Add support for converting ConnectionInfo and RemoveInfo advisory messages to AMQP format, including serialization of relevant fields. Includes new test cases to validate transformation behavior [AMQ-6895].

---

The commit introduces handling for `ConnectionInfo` and `RemoveInfo` messages in the AMQP outbound transformer. It adds serialization logic to convert these advisory messages into AMQP `AmqpValue` structures and includes corresponding test cases to ensure proper transformation and field inclusion.

feat: Handle Advisory messages by including their data structures in the AMQP message body

This change adds support for serializing ConnectionInfo and RemoveInfo data structures in the body of AMQP messages, addressing AMQ-7068. The body now contains structured information about connections and consumers, making advisory messages more informative. Unit tests for ConnectionInfo and RemoveInfo transformation have been added.

**Commit message 4:**

fix: enhance advisory message handling for AMQP

Add support for ConnectionInfo and RemoveInfo data structures in AMQP messages [AMQ-7068]. Includes tests to validate transformation of these message types.

Add validation and sanitization for audit logging options to ensure correct configuration and prevent invalid setups.

Sanitize audit_logging_options when loading from cassandra.yaml to ensure consistent behavior with nodetool enableauditlog. This trims whitespace from category names, resolving CASSANDRA-20208.

Allow dispatching hints during schema mismatches to improve upgrade/mixed-version cluster resilience [CASSANDRA-20188].

fix: Move Kubernetes client creation into KubernetesRun and fix shutdown issues

This change addresses issues with Kubernetes client shutdown and manifest resolution by relocating the Kubernetes client creation method to KubernetesRun and adjusting manifest file handling. Fixes CAMEL-21625 and CAMEL-21621.

Here are the concise commit messages based on each Git diff and their contexts:

---

### Commit Message 1:

**feat:** add `-skip-empty-file` option to `getmerge`

Add flag to skip appending newline delimiters for empty files when using `-nl` [HADOOP-12657]. Includes tests validating flag behavior for zero-byte files.

---

### Commit Message 2:

**fix:** truncate exception messages to prevent resource exhaustion

Limit exception message size to 1024 characters with `...` suffix [AMQ-6894]. This reduces memory/thread consumption from oversized messages during repeated failover attempts.

---

### Commit Message 3:

**fix:** remove schema version check for hint delivery

Allow dispatching hints during schema mismatches to improve upgrade/mixed-version cluster resilience [CASSANDRA-20188].

---

### Commit Message 4:

**fix:** fix Kubernetes shutdown hook and manifest cleanup

Move `createKubernetesClientForShutdownHook()` to `KubernetesRun` and handle exceptions for missing manifest files [CAMEL-21621, CAMEL-21625]. Now handles `Client is closed` and `FileNotFoundException` properly during shutdown.

---

refactor: improve BratDocumentStream with constants and file sorting

Use constants for file extensions and sort files before processing to ensure consistent document order. This improves code clarity and maintainability.

The changes introduce constants for .ann and .txt file extensions, and sort files before processing to ensure consistent document order when reading from directories.

fix: Make BratDocumentStream process files deterministically

Ensure files are processed in a consistent order by sorting them alphabetically and using constants for file suffixes. This resolves non-determinism issues as described in OPENNLP-1702.

fix: sort files deterministically in BratDocumentStream [OPENNLP-1702]

Sort files alphabetically to ensure consistent processing order when reading from the brat corpus directory.

Add thread-safe implementations using ThreadLocal to ensure safe concurrent access without model duplication. Includes updates to LemmatizerME and NameFinderME classes for consistency and resource management.

feat: Add thread-safe ChunkerME implementation and related fixes

Added ThreadSafeChunkerME for thread-safe chunking operations. Improved thread-local management in related classes to allow explicit cleanup, addressing OPENNLP-1667 and OPENNLP-1620.

fix: Prevent custom models from being wiped and validate existing models

Added method to check for existing valid models, removed test class wiping models, and updated tests to verify model existence and validity. This prevents accidental deletion of custom models and reduces unnecessary downloads. (OPENNLP-1661)

fix: prevent accidental deletion of custom models in user directory

Improve model download logic to skip existing valid models and avoid deleting custom files [OPENNLP-1661]. Remove problematic test cleanup code that wiped user models.

---

fix: prevent accidental deletion of custom models in user directory

Improve model download logic to skip existing valid models and avoid deleting custom files. Remove test cleanup code that wiped user models. Add validation for existing models and better download handling.

refactor: extract abbreviation dictionary parameter from sentence and tokenization models

Extract Dictionary parameter from SentenceModel and TokenizerModel constructors to improve flexibility and testability. This change allows Dictionary to be specified independently of the model, enabling different abbreviation dictionaries to be used without altering the underlying model configuration.

---

This change introduces a new constructor in several classes, allowing the Dictionary (abbreviation dictionary) to be explicitly passed rather than being retrieved directly from the model. This provides more flexibility in scenarios where different abbreviation dictionaries need to be used with the same model, without requiring changes to the model itself. The refactoring also improves testability by decoupling the Dictionary from the model initialization.

feat: add constructors for custom abbreviation dictionaries

Adds constructors that accept a Dictionary for abbreviation handling in SentenceDetectorME, ThreadSafeSentenceDetectorME, TokenizerME, and ThreadSafeTokenizerME to support custom abbreviation dictionaries as requested in OPENNLP-1655.

feat: add custom abbreviation dictionary support to TokenizerME and SentenceDetectorME

Add constructors to accept a Dictionary for abbreviation handling [OPENNLP-1655]. This enables custom abbreviation injection in tokenization and sentence detection. Updated constructors in related classes to support this feature.

feat: add support for custom POSTagFormat with no-op mapper

Add CUSTOM format option and corresponding NoOp mapper to preserve original tags. Includes tests ensuring proper handling of custom formatted tags.

feat: Add support for custom POS tag format without mapping

This change introduces a new feature that allows disabling the POS tag mapper by using the CUSTOM format, addressing OPENNLP-1600.

feat: add option to disable POS tag mapper

Add support for disabling automatic POS tag mapping by using the CUSTOM format [OPENNLP-1600]. Includes test cases for the new behavior.

feat: enable client hostname verification configuration

Add support for configuring client hostname verification separately from server verification [ZOOKEEPER-6894]. Introduces new `sslClientHostnameVerification` property to allow independent control of hostname verification for clients.

feat: Add configuration option to control client hostname verification

Adds `ssl.clientHostnameVerification` configuration option to enable or disable client hostname verification for TLS quorum connections. This allows better control over hostname verification behavior when dealing with reverse DNS issues in Kubernetes and other environments where multiple DNS names may be resolved.

feat: add -skip-empty-file option to getmerge

Add flag to skip appending newline delimiters for empty files when using -nl [HADOOP-12657]. Includes tests validating flag behavior for zero-byte files.

fix: allow DIGEST-MD5 authentication for quorum authorization

Modify quorum SASL callback handler to handle DIGEST-MD5 authentication and principals without host-based authorization. This improves compatibility with environments using non-host-based service principals.

fix: Handle DIGEST-MD5 vs GSSAPI in quorum SASL auth

Update SASL callback handler to distinguish between DIGEST-MD5 and GSSAPI mechanisms, adjusting credential handling and authorization checks accordingly. Add tests to validate handling of host-based and hostless principals.

perf: optimize snapshot and restore operations with lock

Remove synchronized methods and introduce a lock for snapshot and restore operations to improve performance and reduce contention [ZOOKEEPER-1234]. This change enhances concurrency during high-frequency snapshotting and restoring.

fix: Remove synchronized from takeSnapshot and restoreFromSnapshot to reduce lock contention

This change introduces a dedicated lock (`snapshotAndRestoreLock`) to synchronize snapshot and restore operations, eliminating contention with the `sync()` operation in `ObserverZookeeperServer` and `FollowerZookeeperServer`. This resolves ZOOKEEPER-4858 by improving concurrency during these operations.

fix: remove synchronized from takeSnapshot and restoreFromSnapshot to reduce lock contention [ZOOKEEPER-4858]. Replace with exclusive lock to prevent contention during snapshot and restore operations.

fix: fix socket binding issues in quorum listener

Modify address creation in ListenerHandler to prevent socket binding issues by constructing a new InetSocketAddress with host string and port. This improves socket listener reliability.

fix: retry DNS lookup when binding quorum listener port

Recreate InetSocketAddress to retry DNS resolution if the address is still unresolved. This addresses cases where DNS becomes available after an initial failure.

The commit message starts with the type 'test:' followed by a brief subject. The body provides context by referencing the ticket and briefly explains the test's purpose.

chore: optimize resource management in RpcEncoder

Refactor message buffer release in RpcEncoder to occur only on encode failure, preventing potential double-free errors and resource leaks. Remove unnecessary message release during successful encode completion.

fix: DRILL-8489: Prevent sender memory leak when RPC encoding fails

This commit resolves a memory leak issue by ensuring that the message is properly released only when encoding fails. It introduces a success flag to track encoding outcomes and releases the message in the finally block if encoding is unsuccessful.

fix: prevent memory leaks on RPC encode failure

Add boolean flag to track encode success and conditionally release messages only when encoding fails [DRILL-8489]. This prevents memory leaks by ensuring messages are properly released when encoding exceptions occur.

feat: add validateHostname option to Splunk connection configuration

Add support for disabling hostname verification during SSL/TLS handshake [DRILL-9999]. Includes updates to test cases to validate both hostname verification scenarios.

feat: Add option to skip host validation for Splunk connections (DRILL-8503)

Added a configuration option to skip hostname verification for SSL connections to Splunk. Related test cases have been updated to include this new option. Also, simplified the field inclusion check in SplunkUtils.

feat: Support configurable host name for Zookeeper advertisement

feat: add configurable host address for Zookeeper advertisement [DRILL-4935]

feat: add support for FILTER clause in aggregate functions

feat: Add support for filtered aggregate calls

feat: add support for filtered aggregate calls
